intro: Phyllanthus wrightii, commonly known as the Wright's spurge, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, inconspicuous flowers and smooth, waxy leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. It produces yellowish-green cyathia, which are specialized inflorescences typical of the spurge family. Phyllanthus wrightii is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
